docs.snippet: After lines were sabotaged, electricity will not be fully restored until an “energy bridge” from Russia is completed in May, according to the Kremlin-appointed government....
docs.lead_paragraph: After lines were sabotaged, electricity will not be fully restored until an “energy bridge” from Russia is completed in May, according to the Kremlin-appointed government.
docs.abstract: Russia-appointed Crimean government says peninsula, which has lacked sufficient electricity since Ukrainian activists sabotaged power lines in Nov 2015, will endure power shortages until May.

headline.main: Crimea to Face Power Shortages for Months, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Russia: Crimea Faces Months of More Power Failures

docs.snippet: Only a third of Russia's air strikes in Syria are targeting Islamic State and its imprecise attacks are forcing the population to flee, fuelling Europe's refugee crisis, a senior U.S. official said on Saturday....

docs.snippet: Hackers likely caused a Dec. 23 electricity outage in Ukraine by remotely switching breakers to cut power, after installing malware to prevent technicians from detecting the attack, according to a report analyzing how the incident unfolded....

docs.snippet: Reports in Iran’s news media that linked a visit by the Turkish president to Saudi Arabia with the kingdom’s execution of a Shiite cleric stirred anger in Turkey....
docs.lead_paragraph: Reports in Iran’s news media that linked a visit by the Turkish president to Saudi Arabia with the kingdom’s execution of a Shiite cleric stirred anger in Turkey.
docs.abstract: Rift between Iran and Saudi Arabia presents growing challenge to Turkey's aspiration to remain above sectarian conflict in Middle East and to serve as honest broker and peacemaker in region.

headline.main: Turkey, Which Sought Middle Ground, Enters Saudi-Iranian Dispute
headline.print_headline: Saudi-Iranian Rift Tugging Turkey Off Its Middle Path

byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

docs.snippet: When North Korea claimed triumphantly that it had tested its first hydrogen bomb, it was roundly and predictably condemned by the United States, China, Russia, Britain, France and India, countries estimated to possess a combined total of more than...
docs.lead_paragraph: When North Korea claimed triumphantly that it had tested its first hydrogen bomb, it was roundly and predictably condemned by the United States, China, Russia, Britain, France and India, countries estimated to possess a combined total of more than 15,000 nuclear warheads.

headline.main: N. Korea Defiance Challenges Moral Authority of Nuclear Club
headline.print_headline: N. Korea Defiance Challenges Moral Authority of Nuclear Club
